intro: Vvedenskyella kashgarica, commonly known as Kashgar rock-cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of Central Asia, particularly found in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often in mountainous areas with limited water availability. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
